page.title: 04GEOGRAPHY OF AREA
page.content: Undulating countryside is the predominant feature of the {landscape}and to the west the river Itchen flows to the sea. The majority of woodland in the area is of the deciduous type and is mostly situated towards the north east although some smaller copses still exist in the newly developed urban {housing}estates and other areas of higher density{population. } Horses and, to a lesser extent, cattle graze on the open pasture farmland which predominates north of the motorway. Little if any crop{farming}is carried out although a few minor small holdings seem to be geared to the cultivation of market garden produce.
